gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Extended Special Sensor Microwave Imager (SSM/I) Sensor Data Record (SDR) in netCDF

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: NOAA National Centers for Environmental Information
DOC/NOAA/NESDIS/NCDC > National Climatic Data Center, NESDIS, NOAA, U.S. Department of Commerce

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: DOC/NOAA/NESDIS/NCDC > National Climatic Data Center, NESDIS, NOAA, U.S. Department of Commerce

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: SSM/I and SSMIS Monitoring and Documentation

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Information and links about SSM/I and SSMIS sensors aboard DMSP satellites.

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: The Special Sensor Microwave Imager (SSM/I) is a seven-channel linearly polarized passive microwave radiometer that operates at frequencies of 19.36 (vertically and horizontally polarized), 22.235 (vertically polarized), 37.0 (vertically and horizontally polarized), and 85.5 GHz (vertically and horizontally polarized). The instrument was carried aboard Defense Meteorological Satellite Program (DMSP) satellites F8, F10, F11, F12, F13, and F15. The Sensor Data Records (SDRs) from SSM/I contain calibrated and earth-located data after antenna pattern corrections have been applied. These SSM/I SDRs in network Common Data Format (netCDF) have embedded temperature and geolocation flags as well as a climatology flag that calculates deviations from a climatological norm for each radiance footprint or z-score. The original radiance and geolocation data are not changed. Variable orbital files from the originating SDR dataset have been aggregated into 3-hourly files for ease of use.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: SSM/I observations provide valuable information on key climate parameters such as water vapor, precipitation, snow cover, sea-ice extent and land-surface temperatures.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: DOC/NOAA/NESDIS/NCEI > National Centers for Environmental Information, NESDIS, NOAA, U.S. Department of Commerce

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Distribution liability: NOAA and NCEI make no warranty, expressed or implied, regarding these data, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty. NOAA and NCEI cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in these data. If appropriate, NCEI can only certify that the data it distributes are an authentic copy of the records that were accepted for inclusion in the NCEI archives.

Use liability: NOAA and NCEI cannot provide any warranty as to the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of furnished data. Users assume responsibility to determine the usability of these data. The user is responsible for the results of any application of this data for other than its intended purpose.

gmd:orderingInstructions.gco:CharacterString: Ordering Instructions: Visit the website for the dataset or contact NCDC to place an order through the User Engagement and Services Branch. For more information about ordering from NCDC, visit http://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/oa/about/ncdcordering.html

gmd:turnaround.gco:CharacterString: Data are available for electronic downloading within hours of placing the order. Delivery of physical media occurs within 1 to 2 weeks, and depends on the data volume and complexity of the order.

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: NOAA CLASS: Defense Meteorological Satellite Program data

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Order interface for SSM/I SDR netCDF data.
Mission Start Date

DMSP F-8 launched. Instruments: Operational Linescan System (OLS), Microwave Temperature Sounder, Ionospheric/Scintillation Monitor, Precipitating Electron/Ion Spectrometer, Microwave Imager (SSM/I) and Advanced X-Ray Detector (SSB/X).
DMSP F-8 operational.
DMSP F-8 ended operation.

DMSP F-9 launched. Instruments: Operational Linescan System (OLS), Ionospheric/Scintillation Monitor (SSI/ES), Precipitating Electron/Ion Spectrometer (SSJ/4), Advanced X-Ray Detector (SSB/X), and Infrared Temperature and Moisture Sounder (SSH-2).
DMSP F-9 ended operation.
DMSP F-10 launched and operational. Instruments: OLS, SSM/I, SSM/T, SSJ/4, SSIES and SSB/X.
DMSP F-10 ended operation.
DMSP F-11 launched. Instruments: OLS, SSM/I, SSM/T, SSM/T2, SSJ/4, SSIES and SSB/X.
DMSP F-11 operational.
DMSP F-11 ended operation.
DMSP F-12 launched. Instruments: OLS, SSB/X-2, SSI/ES-2, SSJ/4, SSM, SSM/I, SSM/T and SSM/T2.
DMSP F-12 operational.
DMSP F-13 launched. Instruments: OLS, SSB/X, SSI/ES-2, SSJ/4, SSM, SSM/I, SSM/T and SSZ.
DMSP F-13 operational.
DMSP F-14 launched. Instruments: OLS, SSB/X-2, SSI/ES-2, SSJ/4, SSM, SSM/I, SSM/T, SSM/T2 and SSZ.
DMSP F-14 operational.
DMSP F-15 launched. Instruments: OLS, SSM/T, SSI/ES-2, SSJ/4, SSM/I, SSM/T2, SSM and Gamma-ray dedectors.
DMSP F-15 operational.
DMSP F-16 launched. Instruments: OLS, SSM/T, SSIES, SSJ/4, SSM/I, SSM/T-2, SSM, SSULI and SSUSI.
DMSP F-16 operational.
DSMP F-17 launched. Instruments: OLS, SSMI/S, SSJ/5, SSIES and SSM.
DSMP F-18 intended launch. Instruments: SSMIS.
DSMP F-19 intended launch.

gmd:other.gco:CharacterString: NOAA National Centers for Environmental Information

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: NOAA created the National Centers for Environmental Information (NCEI) by merging NOAA's National Climatic Data Center (NCDC), National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), and National Oceanographic Data Center (NODC), including the National Coastal Data Development Center (NCDDC), per the Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2015, Public Law 113-235. NCEI launched publicly on April 22, 2015.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Bulk metadata change applied on 2018-05-25. See version control repository history for metadata change details.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: DOC/NOAA/NESDIS/NGDC > National Geophysical Data Center, NESDIS, NOAA, U.S. Department of Commerce

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Short description of SSM/I sensor aboard DMSP satellites.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: Collection Type: conical scan, Collection Description: The instrument sweeps a 450 cone around the satellite velocity vector so that the Earth incidence angle is always 540. Data are recorded during the 102.40 of the cone when the antenna beam intercepts the Earth's surface. The channel footprint varies with channel energy, position in the scan, along scan or along track direction and altitude of the satellite. The 85 GHz footprint is the smallest with a 13 x 15 km and the 19 GHz footprint is the largest at 43 x 69 km. Because the 85 GHz footprint is so small, it is sampled twice as often, i.e., 128 times a scan. One data cycle consists of 4 85 GHz scans and 2 scans of the 19, 22 and 37 GHz channels. The complete cycle takes 28 seconds and it must be complete to process the data.

The DMSP designs, builds, launches, and maintains satellites monitoring the meteorological, oceanographic, and solar-terrestrial physics environments. Equipped with a sophisticated sensor suite that can image visible and infrared cloud cover, the satellites collect specialized meteorological, oceanographic, and solar-geophysical information in all weather conditions.
DMSP F10 - Launched December 1, 1990. Instruments: OLS, SSM/I, SSM/T, SSJ/4 and SSIES. Operational Dates: March 9, 1992 - November 4, 1997.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: DMSP > Defense Meteorological Satellite Program

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: DMSP F11 - Launched on November 28, 1991. Instruments: OLS, SSM/I, SSM/T, SSM/T2, SSJ/4 and SSIES. Operational Dates: December 6, 1991 - May 16, 2000.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: DMSP > Defense Meteorological Satellite Program

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: DMSP F12 - Launched August 28, 1994. Instruments: OLS, SSB/X-2, SSI/ES-2, SSJ/4, SSM, SSM/I, SSM/T and SSM/T2. Operational dates: September 8, 1994 - Present.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: DMSP > Defense Meteorological Satellite Program

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: DMSP 5D-2/F13 - Launched March 24, 1995. Instruments: OLS, SSB/X, SSI/ES-2, SSJ/4, SSM, SSM/I, SSM/T and SSZ. Operational dates: March 25, 1995 - present.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: DMSP > Defense Meteorological Satellite Program

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: DMSP F14 - Launched on April 10, 1997. Instruments: OLS, SSB/X-2, SSI/ES-2, SSJ/4, SSM, SSM/I, SSM/T and SSM/T2. Operational dates: April 4, 1997 - present.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: DMSP > Defense Meteorological Satellite Program

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: DMSP 5D-2/F15 - Launched on December 12, 1999. Instruments: OLS, SB/X-2, SSI/ES-2, SSJ/4, SSM, SSM/I, SSM/T and SSM/T2. Operational dates: January 24, 2000 - present.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: DMSP > Defense Meteorological Satellite Program
